title: Remediating Student Debt’s Failing Grades
sub_head: The expected taxpayer losses on student-loan debt highlight the disastrous consequence of shielding the higher-education industry from the loan losses incurred for its services.
body:
The expected taxpayer losses on student-loan debt highlight the disastrous consequence of shielding the higher-education industry from the loan losses incurred for its services (“U.S. Faces $400 Billion Student-Loan Loss,” Page One, Nov. 23). Because these risks are borne by the taxpayer, colleges raise prices confident that government loan guarantees will facilitate student borrowing to pay the increased costs.
